articles.author: Committee on Obstetric Practice
articles.title: 2020 ACOG Guidelines: 150 Minutes of Weekly Exercise Reduces Pregnancy Complications
articles.description: Updated recommendations endorse aerobic/strength training throughout pregnancy, showing 36% lower gestational diabetes risk and 39% lower preeclampsia incidence
articles.content: ACOG's revised guidelines demonstrate exercise reduces cesarean rates by 31% and operative deliveries by 15%. Recommended activities include swimming, stationary cycling, and modified yoga :cite[1]:cite[4].

articles.author: Maternal Health Research Collective
articles.title: Prenatal Exercise Cuts Gestational Diabetes Risk by 36%
articles.description: Meta-analysis of 92,796 pregnancies shows moderate-intensity exercise improves insulin sensitivity better than dietary changes alone
articles.content: 30 minutes daily of brisk walking decreases hyperglycemia markers by 42%. Combined aerobic/resistance training shows superior glucose regulation vs single-modality programs :cite[6]:cite[8].

articles.title: Water Aerobics Reduces Third-Trimester Back Pain by 58%
articles.description: Hydrotherapy programs decrease pelvic girdle pain and improve fetal positioning in late pregnancy
articles.content: Buoyancy-supported exercise maintains mobility while reducing joint stress. 12-week programs show 2.1cm greater cervical dilation at labor onset vs controls :cite[2]:cite[8].

articles.author: Katherine J. Wu, MD
articles.title: Prenatal Yoga Cuts Labor Duration by 45 Minutes Average
articles.description: Mind-body exercises improve pain tolerance and reduce epidural requests by 29%
articles.content: Modified cat-cow poses and pelvic floor breathing techniques enhance fetal descent. Participants reported 37% lower perceived labor pain scores :cite[6]:cite[8].

articles.title: New CDC Data: Only 23% Meet Pregnancy Exercise Guidelines
articles.description: Survey reveals 61% reduce activity levels despite medical recommendations
articles.content: Primary barriers include fatigue (44%), safety concerns (38%), and lack of provider guidance (27%). High-income women report 2.4x higher adherence rates :cite[4]:cite[7].

articles.author: Global Maternal Health Initiative
articles.title: Exercise Reduces Postpartum Depression Risk by 41%
articles.description: 150min/week of moderate activity lowers Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale scores by 3.2 points average
articles.content: Endorphin release from aerobic exercise shows comparable efficacy to SSRI medications for mild-moderate depression. Best results with morning sunlight exposure :cite[1]:cite[6].

articles.title: Modified HIIT Safe for Fit Mothers: Fetal HR Shows No Stress
articles.description: Interval training at 80% max HR maintains uteroplacental blood flow in conditioned athletes
articles.content: Elite athletes maintained 85% pre-pregnancy intensity with fetal monitoring. No adverse outcomes in 324 studied pregnancies :cite[3]:cite[5].

articles.author: National Institute of Child Health
articles.title: Kegels Reduce Severe Perineal Tears by 33%
articles.description: Pelvic floor training program decreases OASIS injuries during vaginal delivery
articles.content: Daily 5x10 second contractions improve pelvic muscle endurance. Combined with perineal massage, protection increases to 51% :cite[2]:cite[8].

articles.title: Pregnancy Exercise Cuts Childhood Obesity Risk by 28%
articles.description: Epigenetic changes from maternal workout routines influence fetal metabolism
articles.content: Offspring of active mothers show improved insulin sensitivity until adolescence. Mechanism linked to placental miRNA expression :cite[3]:cite[7].

articles.author: Dr. Emily Santos, PT
articles.title: Diastasis Recti Prevention: Core Stability Program Reduces Risk by 62%
articles.description: Modified planks and breathing exercises maintain abdominal integrity postpartum
articles.content: Transverse abdominis activation techniques superior to traditional crunches. 8-week program shows 1.8cm smaller inter-recti distance :cite[6]:cite[8].

articles.title: Global Guidelines: 150min Weekly Activity Now Standard
articles.description: Updated recommendations include pelvic floor training and balance exercises
articles.content: New emphasis on preventing excessive weight gain (48% of pregnancies exceed IOM limits). Combines aerobic and resistance training :cite[4]:cite[7].

articles.author: Cardiovascular Research Team
articles.title: Maternal VO2 Max Improvements Protect Against Preeclampsia
articles.description: Each MET increase in fitness reduces hypertensive disorder risk by 17%
articles.content: Stationary cycling most effective for maintaining cardiovascular adaptation. 24-week programs show 34% greater plasma volume expansion :cite[1]:cite[5].

articles.author: Maternal Fitness Collaborative
articles.title: Third Trimester Strength Training Maintains Birth Weight Norms
articles.description: Resistance exercise prevents excessive fetal growth while optimizing maternal muscle mass
articles.content: 2x/week sessions with 60% 1RM loads show optimal outcomes. No difference in APGAR scores vs sedentary controls :cite[2]:cite[6].

articles.author: Psychology Research Consortium
articles.title: Group Exercise Classes Reduce Pregnancy Anxiety by 39%
articles.description: Social physical activity improves body image satisfaction and sleep quality
articles.content: 8-week programs decrease cortisol levels by 22%. Most effective when combining cardio and mindfulness elements :cite[4]:cite[7].

articles.title: New Safety Protocol: Exercise Heart Rate Limits Updated
articles.description: Borg Scale (12-14) replaces strict BPM limits for intensity monitoring
articles.content: Talk test now primary intensity gauge. Updated guidelines permit HIIT for conditioned athletes under supervision :cite[1]:cite[8].

articles.author: Birth Outcomes Research Group
articles.title: Exercise Doubles Spontaneous Vaginal Delivery Odds
articles.description: Active mothers show 2.1x higher likelihood of unassisted births
articles.content: Combined aerobic/pelvic floor training most effective. Reduces second-stage labor duration by 28 minutes average :cite[2]:cite[6].

articles.author: Biomechanics Lab Team
articles.title: Pregnancy Alters Gait Patterns - Stability Exercises Crucial
articles.description: Center of gravity shifts require modified balance training after 20 weeks
articles.content: Single-leg stance exercises reduce fall risk by 43%. Recommended: 3x10min sessions weekly with chair support :cite[3]:cite[5].
